result.execSummary:
The defendant John Raymond Matzke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant John Raymond Matzke in court with attorney Vanessa R Paster.  Scott Henry Dirks appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads no contest; Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders sentence withheld, 12 months probation, may petition to expunge upon completion of probation, costs of $443 due 4/13/17, no sentence credit.
